required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sonographic Detection of Prophylactic Pancreatic Stents
clinical_study.official_title: Sonographic Detection of Pancreatic Stents Placed for Prophylaxis of Post-ERCP Pancreatitis

brief_summary.textblock: The Retention of pancreatic stents for prophylaxis of post-ERCP pancreatitis (PEP) is assessed by abdominal x-ray according to international Guidelines. The current study aimed to analyze whether prophylactic pancreatic stents can be detected by transdermal ultrasound to save the x-ray examination.

detailed_description.textblock: Pancreatitis is the most common complication of endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP). Several pharmacologic and procedure-related measurements have been established for post-ERCP pancreatitis (PEP) prophylaxis one being the placement of pancreatic duct stents in patients with high risk for PEP. The beneficial role of pancreatic stenting in the prophylaxis of PEP was demonstrated in large meta-analyses. The used stents have a high potential of self dislodgment, retained stents have to be removed endoscopically after 5-10 days. For evaluation of spontaneous stent passage abdominal x-ray ist used and accordingly retained stents removed. The current study aimed to analyze whether prophylactic pancreatic stents can be detected by transdermal ultrasound to save the x-ray examination.

primary_outcome.measure: Positive predictive value of the sonographic detection of pancreatic stents
primary_outcome.description: Test whether the stents can be detected reliably by ultrasound

secondary_outcome.measure: Negative predictive value of the sonographic detection of pancreatic stents
secondary_outcome.description: Test whether and why the stents cannot be detected reliably by ultrasound

arm_group.description: abdominal ultrasound and x-ray for stent detection.

intervention.description: Abdominal ultrasound for detection of the pancreatic stent

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient after pancreatic stent placement for prophylaxis of post-ERCP pancreatitis
- age 18-79
- signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- any disease that rules out study participation
- patient not legally competent to sign informed consent
- chronic pancreatis as indication for pancreatic stenting
